com.ensoftcorp.open.immutability.analysis

Class ImmutabilityAnalysis

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ensoftcorp.open.immutability.analysis.ImmutabilityAnalysis

  • public class ImmutabilityAnalysis
extends java.lang.Object
    An Atlas native implementation a context-sensitive reference immutability analysis This algorithm is based off the algorithm proposed in: Reference 1: ReIm & ReImInfer: Checking and Inference of Reference Immutability, OOPSLA 2012 Reference 2: Method Purity and ReImInfer: Method Purity Inference for Java, FSE 2012
    Author:
    Ben Holland, Ganesh Santhanam

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.lang.String MUTABLE
      Tag applied to fields, parameters, variables, etc.
      static java.lang.String POLYREAD
      Tag applied to fields, parameters, variables, etc.
      static java.lang.String PURE_METHOD
      Tag applied to "pure" methods
      static java.lang.String READONLY
      Tag applied to fields, parameters, variables, etc.
      static java.lang.String UNTYPED
      Tag applied to references that resulted in no immutability types This tag should ideally never be applied and represents and error in the type system or implementation

    • Field Detail

      • PURE_METHOD

        public static final java.lang.String PURE_METHOD
        Tag applied to "pure" methods
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • READONLY

        public static final java.lang.String READONLY
        Tag applied to fields, parameters, variables, etc. denoting a "readonly" immutability Readonly means that in any context the reference is readonly (never mutated)
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • POLYREAD

        public static final java.lang.String POLYREAD
        Tag applied to fields, parameters, variables, etc. denoting a "polyread" immutability Polyread means that depending on the context a reference may be mutable or readonly
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • MUTABLE

        public static final java.lang.String MUTABLE
        Tag applied to fields, parameters, variables, etc. denoting a "mutable" immutability Mutable means that in any context the reference is mutable
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • UNTYPED

        public static final java.lang.String UNTYPED
        Tag applied to references that resulted in no immutability types This tag should ideally never be applied and represents and error in the type system or implementation
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

        Returns:
        Returns the time in milliseconds taken to complete the analysis
